intro: Cladium preissii, commonly known as the Australian sawgrass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Australia. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and long, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine, hair-like structures. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spikelets, followed by the development of three-angled, ribbed seeds. Cladium preissii thrives in wetland environments, often found in swamps, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. Its ability to tolerate fluctuating water levels makes it an important component of aquatic ecosystems.
